related_post.text: I'm trying to get the IPv6 of my clients. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16276913/reliablygetipv6addressinpython```pydef get_ip_6(host): # search for all addresses but take only the v6 ones alladdr = socket.getaddrinfo(host,PORT) ip6 = filter( lambda x: x[0] == socket.AF_INET6 # means its ip6 alladdr ) # if you want just the sockaddr #return map(lambda x:x[4],ip6) HERE return list(ip6)[0][4][0] # AND HERE```The first return is just equal to: `<map object at 0x07E70130>`While the one that isn't commented is just an empty list.

so_post.text: I'm trying to get the IPv6 of my clients. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16276913/reliablygetipv6addressinpython```pydef get_ip_6(host): # search for all addresses but take only the v6 ones alladdr = socket.getaddrinfo(host,PORT) ip6 = filter( lambda x: x[0] == socket.AF_INET6 # means its ip6 alladdr ) # if you want just the sockaddr #return map(lambda x:x[4],ip6) HERE return list(ip6)[0][4][0] # AND HERE```The first return is just equal to: `<map object at 0x07E70130>`While the one that isn't commented is just an empty list.
